18684.name: PixCut remove background
18684.description:
One-click to remove background from image! Wondershare PixCut plugin will help you to make image background transparent automatically for free.


Sign up Wondershare PixCut and get free appkey.

19148.name: Figma 2D World
19148.description:
Figma Gaming Plugin |

create maze inside the frame and play with friends! 🕺💃


Game Setup:

  1. Find a Frame to be your maze (better not to use your working frame 📌)
  2. Set all the obstacle inside the frame as their name -> "rect" in the layer panel
  3. Set your character inside the frame as the name -> "target" in the layer panel
  4. Open the plugin and you're ready to go.
  5. have some fun with your friends and design team member, Figma handles all the realtime-sync!


Game Instruction:

  1. use arrow key to control the direction: (left <-) / (right->), use x to jump.
  2. your character might fall out the frame / stick at some where, you can close the plugin, put the character back to a safe area, and re-start the plugin again

18694.name: downloadPNG
18694.description:
Save any frame as PNG


How to use:

  1. Choosse frame or artboard
  2. Open plugin
  3. Press „Download“ button

19150.name: Mirror Actual Screen Size
19150.description:
Mirror the actual size of the screen you are designing on Figma Mirror. Very useful when you don't have all devices with different sizes or if you are designing for IoT.


How to

  • Run plugin, or select a frame and run plugin
  • Enter the screen specs
  • Hit enter. This plugin will frame your artboard so what you see on Figma Mirror is the actual size.
  • (use a ruler to check if you doubt 🌞 )
  • Enjoy the actual screen size on your Figma Mirror app.


Github repo: https://github.com/rickyzhangca/Mirror-Actual-Screen-Size
19150.release_notes: - added an option for centring the frame

18649.name: Removal.ai
18649.description:
Automatically remove background, just a click, things have never been that easy!


Note:

  1. You will need a Removal.ai account, Removal.ai Subcription (can use preview limit) and its api token for this feature.
  2. Plugin developed by REMOVAL.AI LTD, using Removal.ai API. For more information, see our terms and conditions.

19149.name: Draw Connector
19149.description:
Draw perfect orthogonal connectors between layers.


Draw Connector is a premium Figma plugin with a limit of 5 free runs per Figma file.


Buy a license to unlock unlimited use →


  • Draw connectors that take the shortest possible path and the fewest possible 90° turns
  • Customize the edges to connect
  • Customize the connector terminals (to one of None, Circle, Arrow, or Orthogonal)
  • Offset the connector terminals
  • Set the stroke color, stroke width, stroke style (solid/dashed), corner radius, and margin
  • Auto-updates when the position or dimension of any connected layers change

18896.name: Nested Corners
18896.description:
Apply the perfect corner radius to nested layers based on the parent corner radius and padding.


👉 Usage

  1. Set the corner radius of the parent frame.
  2. Make sure the parent frame has auto layout enabled and its padding is uniform.
  3. Select the child layer and run the plugin.


✅ Supported

  • Apply to multiple selections at once
  • Frames with mixed corner radii
  • Corner smoothing


❌ Not Supported

  • Frames with mixed padding
  • Layer types other than RECTANGLE, FRAME, and COMPONENT
  • Changing the parent corner radius based on child corner radius
18896.release_notes: - Added relaunch button for selected layers

18721.name: Match Corner Margins
18721.description:
A one-click utility to resize an object to fill the frame according to top and left margins.


Instructions:

1) Place your object in a frame with your desired spacing from the top edge and the left edge.

2) Select your object (or multiple objects).

3) Run the plugin.


Done! The object(s) will be resized so that the shape fills the frame with the bottom margin matching the top margin, and the right margin matching the left margin.


Why?

I often find myself placing an object in a frame according to how far I want it from the top left corner. Then I have to drag out the bottom right corner and eyeball where it approximately matches the same spacing I applied to the top left corner, wasting several seconds pressing alt to check spacing, and dragging/nudging the edges to fit. I find that this plugin cuts out a couple precious seconds of hassle.


Notes:

  • All object types (such as shapes, components, text boxes, frames, and groups) are supported.
  • Multiple objects, within the same frame or across multiple different frames, can be selected and resized at once.
  • Selected objects must exist within a parent frame.

18720.name: IconCrab - Icon Exporter
18720.description:
Export / Generate productions ready IconCrab from Figma in seconds.


Features

  • Customizable sizes
  • Resize multiple icons with multiple sizes in Figma
  • Export all selected icons Folder according to their size
  • Export multiple file extensions


To use IconCrab

  1. Install and run the “IconCrab - Icon Exporter” plugin.
  2. Highlight frame(s) in your Figma project to preview your icon(s) on left side as slider.
  3. Choose sizes which you want to. You can customize your special sizes on the right side
  4. Choose file extension(s)
  5. If you want to export icons as a zip file check the file checkbox. If not, only can check Figma.
  6. Click the Export button


License

After you've tried exporting icons with IconCrab 3 times, you'll be asked to enter your license key. Your license key will allow you or your team to export an unlimited amount of favicons using IconCrab.


To purchase a license for you or your team, please visit https://gum.co/iconcrab (Gumroad)

18706.name: Autolayout Shortcut Helper
18706.description:
Provides a way for you to assign keyboard shortcuts for "Space Between" and "Packed" 


AutoLayout is great, I spend all day using it. But I need an easier way to switch between spacing modes. Usually- I have to move my cursor, click a dropdown, and click. This plugin exposes the "Space Between" and "Packed" options to the menubar, making it possible to assign keyboard shortcuts to them.


Definetly a hack, but still useful!!


Thanks @desktopofsamuel for sharing the original asset used in my cover art.

18675.name: SVG2Layers
18675.description: Copy and paste SVG code directly into Figma.

18848.name: Quick scale
18848.description:
A simple plugin to proportionally scale any selected elements by a set amount. No popup – just choose your scaling factor and voilà.


Assigning keyboard shortcuts is on you but the individual menu commands make that easy as pie. If you’ve not done this before Apple have instructions for setting shortcuts on a mac.


Why such a basic plugin? Right now Figma pastes retina images at their full pixel dimensions. If (like me) you find yourself scaling these by 50% an awful lot, a keyboard shortcut is a rather handy thing. Ideally the plugin would be called "Paste and scale" but triggering a system paste in a Figma plugin seems tricky or a no-go – contributions welcome!

18707.name: SVG Animate
18707.description:
Bring your Figma creations to life with stunning animations and seamless export to web.


How it create SVG Animations:

  1. Select the Frame you want to animate and click on Enable SVG Export.
  2. Select a node within that Frame to set up animations such as X Position, Y Position, Scale, Rotation and Opacity.
  3. Use the built-in live-preview to tweak your animations until you're happy with the result.
  4. Download or copy the animated SVG and paste it on your website.


How to use SVG Animations on my Website:

  1. SVG Animate uses a small web component library under the hood to make your animations work.
  2. This library uses GreenSock GSAP, a powerful, lightweight and performant animation engine.
  3. When exporting from SVG Animate, you can download or copy the snippet with the click of a button, and paste it on your website. No complicated setup needed.
